intro: Hieracium dissomorphum, commonly known as the two-form dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and is native to southern Africa. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Hieracium dissomorphum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats and is often found in open, sunny environments.
